Package com.google.crypto.tink

Class InternalKeyManager.KeyFactory<KeyFormatProtoT extends com.google.protobuf.MessageLite,KeyT>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.google.crypto.tink.InternalKeyManager.KeyFactory<KeyFormatProtoT,KeyT>
  • Enclosing class:
    InternalKeyManager<KeyProtoT extends com.google.protobuf.MessageLite>
    protected abstract static class InternalKeyManager.KeyFactory<KeyFormatProtoT extends com.google.protobuf.MessageLite,KeyT>
extends Object
    A KeyFactory creates new keys from a given KeyFormat.

    A KeyFactory implements all the methods which are required if an InternalKeyManager should also be able to generate keys. In particular, in this case it needs to have some KeyFormat protocol buffer which can be validated, parsed, and from which a key can be generated.
